sub_title: Peace, Equality, and Positive Change Advocate | Humanitarian Action Young Professional
summary:
In the pursuit of truth and beauty, my journey takes me where cultures converge, ideas fuse, and the transformative power of arts & media fuel social change🌍.

Salaam, Hey there! I'm Salim 🌟, a passionate Dutch-Ghanaian advocate for peace, equality, and positive change through arts and media🎨. 

My path began by engaging with local Tunisian teenagers as an Art Trainer, where I witnessed the incredible impact that artistic expression can have on building connections, empowerment, and fostering dialogue. This experience opened my eyes to the potential role of the arts as a catalyst for positive change. 🎭

Back on home ground, I channelled my newfound passion into concrete actions. Joining student associations, organizing events, and diving into a thesis on artistic initiatives for peacebuilding shaped my understanding🤝.

Growing up mixed-race in the Netherlands, I learned to navigate a dual identity—sometimes blending in, other times standing out. This journey taught me the value of embracing diversity and forging connections across cultures🌐.

Passionate about being a global citizen, I've woven my Dutch-Ghanaian heritage into a commitment to reduce inequality and drive positive change through arts & media.

My distinct blend of artistic creativity, cross-cultural insights, and dedication to social impact empowers me to innovate within the realm of peacebuilding and promote equality.

As a practitioner of social research, a leader, and a skilled public speaker, I carry this mission forward, driven by open-minded empathy and a dynamic skill set. 🚀

I am positioned as a driving force for positive change, aspiring to create a world where diversity is celebrated and bridges of understanding are built. 🌈

Feel free to connect if you're as excited as I am about making a meaningful impact! 🤝

education.field_of_study: Crisis & Security Management specialized in Intelligence & National Security
Political Science - International Relations and Organisations

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

certifications.name: Master Honours Class: 'Leiden, City of Refugees? Reflecting on 'the other' through artistic and scientific research

projects.title: A Comprehensive Introduction to Wargaming: Water Security Edition
projects.description: Collaborating with JASON Institute and NATO Communications, I participated in a wargaming simulation focused on water security. We analyzed strategic scenarios, including the construction of the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam, and applied eclectic approaches in a 3-round business war game. This experience deepened my understanding of water-related challenges and reinforced my commitment to contributing to peace and security efforts.

contributors.headline: Peace, Equality, and Positive Change Advocate | Humanitarian Action Young Professional

projects.title: Fundraiser for KiKa: Mondial Stairs Run - Kaal Voor Kanker
projects.description: I served as the project leader for a stair-sponsorship run (fundraiser) organized entirely by the VWO Student Council at Mondial College. This initiative was conducted in conjunction with the larger Kaal Voor Kanker 2018 "Bald for Cancer 2018" campaign at Mondial College. The stair run was named "Mondial Stairs Run" and successfully raised a total of 1,400 euros. The funds collected from this event were combined with the proceeds of the "Bald for Cancer" campaign, which raised almost 43,000 euros for the Children Cancer Free Foundation (KiKa).

contributors.headline: Peace, Equality, and Positive Change Advocate | Humanitarian Action Young Professional

projects.title: Internationalization Project
projects.description: Initiated and coordinated an Erasmus+ Youth Exchange program, which sparked increased interest in internationalization projects at Mondial College. As a result, the school established new international contacts and facilitated an exchange program involving high school students from Estonia, Russia, Hungary, and the Netherlands. Additionally, I contributed to the development and implementation of an internationalization policy for the institution.

contributors.headline: Peace, Equality, and Positive Change Advocate | Humanitarian Action Young Professional

projects.title: Crisis Simulation at the Ministry of Education, Culture, and Science (OCW)
projects.description: As a participant in the crisis simulation organized by OCW and LAKS (National Action Committee of Students), I engaged in a stimulating and immersive experience at the Ministry of Education, Culture, and Science in the Netherlands. The simulation game focused on crisis communication and policy maker briefing, providing a unique opportunity to hone my decision-making, problem-solving, and communication skills in a high-pressure scenario. This enriching experience allowed me to gain valuable insights into the workings of a governmental institution and further develop my ability to navigate complex situations effectively.

contributors.headline: Peace, Equality, and Positive Change Advocate | Humanitarian Action Young Professional

projects.title: Scholierenverkiezingen Tweede Kamer 2017
projects.description: Organiseren van Tweede Kamer verkiezingen op het Mondial College. Alle leerlingen en al het personeel konden op hun favoriete partij stemmen. Project was ter interesse vorming in de Nederlandse politiek.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer Support and Social Media Strategist for NGO in Uganda
volunteer_experiences.description:
As a dedicated volunteer, I provided valuable support to the organization by teaching children and contributing to their educational growth in Uganda. Additionally, I took the initiative to develop a comprehensive social media strategy aimed at fundraising efforts. Through strategic planning and engaging content, I sought to raise awareness about the organization's mission and attract potential donors.

My role as a teacher allowed me to connect with children, fostering a nurturing and inclusive learning environment. I actively engaged with the students, helping them develop essential skills and empowering them with knowledge.

In recognition of the increasing importance of online presence for nonprofits, I took the lead in crafting a well-defined social media strategy. By leveraging various platforms, I sought to amplify the organization's impact and reach a wider audience. My efforts were directed towards inspiring individuals to support the cause and contribute to positive change.

Furthermore, I had the privilege of visiting and advising various other NGOs, sharing insights and best practices. This unique experience enabled me to gain a broader perspective on different approaches to addressing social issues and building sustainable solutions.

My dedication to supporting the organization's mission through teaching, social media management, and providing advisory services allowed me to make a meaningful contribution to their overall growth and success. I firmly believe in the power of collective efforts, and my volunteer work reflects my commitment to creating a positive and lasting impact on the lives of those in need.

As an event photographer in Uganda Masaka, I had the incredible opportunity to capture the essence and excitement of various sporting events, including the Marathon, Duathlon, and Triathlon, along with other engaging activities. These events were organized to raise funds for the NGO SAINT Uganda, and I had the privilege of documenting the collective efforts of both expats and locals participating side by side.

My role involved preserving the memorable moments and captivating scenes of the events, from the participants' determination and sportsmanship to the vibrant atmosphere that surrounded the activities. Through my lens, I aimed to convey the spirit of unity, achievement, and community collaboration that permeated each event.

By skillfully documenting these impactful moments, I contributed to the promotion and recognition of the NGO SAINT Uganda's noble cause, which works tirelessly to support and uplift communities in need. My photographs were instrumental in spreading awareness and garnering support for the organization's initiatives.

Being an event photographer in Uganda Masaka allowed me to combine my passion for photography with a profound appreciation for community engagement and social impact. Witnessing the convergence of diverse individuals coming together for a shared purpose inspired me to showcase the power of collective action through visual storytelling.

Through my work, I aimed to immortalize the genuine emotions, triumphs, and celebrations of the participants, reflecting the true essence of the events. It was a deeply fulfilling experience to play a part in preserving these remarkable moments while supporting a cause that brings positive change to the lives of those in need.

volunteer_experiences.role: Chairperson of a Polling Station - National Elections
volunteer_experiences.description:
As the Chairperson of a polling station during the national elections in The Hague, I assumed a vital role in overseeing the electoral process and coordinating a team of dedicated election workers. My responsibilities encompassed ensuring the smooth and efficient conduct of voting procedures while upholding the principles of fairness and transparency.

Before the election day, I diligently prepared the polling station, ensuring that all necessary materials, equipment, and ballots were in place. I provided comprehensive training to the election team, equipping them with the knowledge and skills needed to assist voters and address any inquiries or challenges.

On the election day, I greeted voters with a warm welcome and guided them through the voting process, verifying their eligibility and ensuring their privacy. Throughout the day, I maintained order and facilitated a well-organized flow of voters to minimize wait times and create a positive voting experience.

As the Chairperson, I supervised the counting of votes, ensuring accuracy and transparency in the tabulation process. I meticulously recorded the results and securely submitted them to the relevant authorities.

Effective communication and leadership were key to managing the diverse team of election workers. I fostered a collaborative and respectful working environment to ensure the team's cohesion and collective dedication to their duties.

Serving as the Chairperson of a polling station during the national elections was an honor and a responsibility I took seriously. I played a crucial role in upholding the democratic values of our nation, ensuring that each eligible voter exercised their right to vote in a fair and secure manner. This experience further reinforced my commitment to supporting and promoting the democratic process in our society.

As a passionate volunteer art trainer, I had the incredible opportunity to teach acting classes with a local NGO in Sousse, Tunisia. Over 8 weeks, five days a week, I nurtured the creativity and acting skills of teenagers from Sousse and Monastir. Our project aimed to bring more culture to the medina of Sousse while providing these young individuals with professional theatre experience. Witnessing their growth and the positive impact on the local community was immensely rewarding. I'm dedicated to promoting cultural enrichment and empowering youth through the transformative power of the arts.

As a volunteer educator at SOS Children's Village Akouda Sousse, I empowered 30 children (ages 6-16) by teaching them about UN SDGs and fostering essential soft and hard skills. It was incredibly fulfilling to contribute to their personal growth and bright futures.

As an active member of the Arts & Media committee at CIROS Community for International Relations and Organisations Students of Leiden University, I played a key role in curating and implementing engaging activities and events that celebrated arts and media.

One of our notable achievements was our involvement in a fundraising project aimed at combating period poverty. In this capacity, I contributed to the project by creating compelling social media content and designing stickers to raise awareness and support for the cause. Additionally, I was responsible for crafting content that promoted talented African artists within our student community, spotlighting their work and fostering a sense of cultural appreciation among our followers.

Our committee's standout event was a successful music showcase held at a local bar, providing a platform for exceptionally talented students from our faculty to exhibit their musical skills. As part of the organizing team, I meticulously planned and coordinated all aspects of the event, collaborating with the venue, selecting performers, managing logistics, and implementing promotional strategies through various channels. The result was an unforgettable evening of musical performances that not only entertained but also cultivated a strong sense of community and artistic appreciation.

Beyond the music event, we continuously sought creative ways to engage our student community by organizing workshops, exhibitions, film screenings, and other art-related activities, which significantly enriched the cultural landscape of our academic institution.

Working alongside a diverse team of passionate individuals, I contributed my organizational and communication skills to ensure the seamless execution of each event. The impact of our efforts in nurturing artistic expression and fostering a vibrant arts and media community has been exceptionally rewarding, reinforcing my dedication to bringing the arts to the forefront of campus life.

volunteer_experiences.role: Central Counter, Provincial Elections 2019 - The Netherlands
volunteer_experiences.description:
As a central counter at the Provincial Elections in 2019, I played a crucial role in the democratic process by contributing to the accurate and transparent counting of votes. During this election, I was responsible for tallying and verifying the votes cast in various regions, ensuring the integrity and fairness of the electoral outcome.

Working in a team of dedicated individuals, I meticulously counted and recorded the votes, adhering to strict protocols and procedures to maintain the highest standards of accuracy and reliability. Additionally, I collaborated with fellow election officials to resolve any discrepancies or issues that arose during the counting process, ensuring that every vote was properly accounted for.

Being a central counter at the Provincial Elections was a fulfilling experience, as I actively participated in upholding the democratic values of our nation and ensuring that the voices of citizens were heard and respected. It was an honor to be part of this essential democratic process and contribute to the foundation of our representative government.

volunteer_experiences.role: Active Member, National High School Student Advocacy Group
volunteer_experiences.description:
As an active member of the national high school student advocacy group, I actively participated in various activities and initiatives aimed at representing the interests and concerns of high school students at a national level. This included being part of panels where we discussed important educational issues and policies, attending Annual General Meetings (ALV) to contribute to decision-making processes, and engaging in the examination complaints line to address and resolve exam-related concerns.

Furthermore, I had the unique opportunity to participate in an exchange program with the Ministry of Education, Culture, and Science (Ministerie van OCW), where I collaborated with policymakers to provide valuable insights from the perspective of high school students. Additionally, I took part in advocacy actions at the Dutch House of Representatives (Tweede Kamer) to advocate for improved career guidance and orientation in high schools.

Being an active member of this advocacy group allowed me to play a significant role in shaping educational policies and enhancing the overall high school experience for students across the nation. It was a rewarding experience that strengthened my passion for promoting positive change in the education system and empowering students to have a voice in important decision-making processes.

As the Chairperson of the Student Council, I demonstrated strong leadership skills by effectively planning and conducting meetings. I took charge of ensuring that action points were carefully monitored and executed, and I delegated tasks among council members to maximize efficiency. Additionally, I maintained open communication with the student body, representing their interests and concerns during discussions with school administrators.

One of my key responsibilities was holding regular monthly meetings with the school's principal to address important issues and advocate for improvements on behalf of the student council and the wider student community. Through my role as the chairperson, I fostered a collaborative and inclusive environment within the student council, encouraging active participation and meaningful contributions from all members. As a result, we successfully implemented positive changes and initiatives that enriched the school experience for everyone involved.

As a student representative to the school board at Mondial College Nijmegen, I served as a dedicated advocate for my fellow students. In this role, I effectively conveyed and defended the viewpoints of all students during regular meetings with the school board. Beyond the formal gatherings, I actively sought input from my peers to ensure their voices were heard and considered in decision-making processes. Collaborating with school administrators and fellow representatives, I worked towards creating a student-centered educational environment and contributed to shaping policies that promoted student welfare and academic success. My commitment to representing the student body fostered a sense of shared responsibility and open dialogue within the school community.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Regional Joint Participation School Council

company.name: Alliantie Voortgezet Onderwijs Nijmegen en het Land van Maas en Waal

volunteer_experiences.description: As a member of the Regional Joint Participation School Council, I represented the viewpoints and interests of students from my region. In this role, I actively advocated for the concerns and opinions of fellow students, ensuring that their voices were heard at the regional level. Through constructive dialogue and collaborative efforts, I worked to influence decisions and policies that directly affected the student community. Being a part of the Regional Joint Participation School Council allowed me to contribute to the improvement of educational experiences and create a positive impact on the lives of students in the region.

company.name: InScience - International Science Film Festival Nijmegen

volunteer_experiences.description: As a Social Media Content Manager, I took charge of creating and curating captivating content and articles for our website and various social media platforms such as Instagram and Facebook. With a keen eye for engaging content, I strategized and executed the posting schedule to enhance our online presence and foster meaningful interactions with our audience. Through effective content management, I played a vital role in strengthening our brand identity and reaching a wider audience across different online channels.

company.name: InScience - International Science Film Festival Nijmegen

volunteer_experiences.description: As a member of the youth jury at the Inscience Film Festival in Nijmegen, I had the honor of awarding the Youth Choice Award to the best film of the festival.

At LAKS (National Union of Secondary School Students), I actively participated in the annual project of receiving, processing, and resolving complaints from students regarding their national exams. Working alongside other secondary school students, we efficiently handled complaints through both an online platform and phone calls. Our essential task was to assess and identify which issues required attention from the national exam creators, aiming to improve the overall examination process for students across the country.

As a Recreation Assistant, I dedicated myself to organizing activities for the elderly, aiming to combat loneliness and promote socialization. Through engaging programs, I provided them with opportunities to have fun, break from their regular routines, and create meaningful connections with others.

Throughout high school, I served as a proactive Student Council Representative, advocating for student concerns, leading projects, and organizing events. Later, I was elected Chairman, empowering student voices and promoting positive change.
